newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain 6-mth T-bills seen steady at Tuesday auction.
newsitem.headline: Spain 6-mth T-bills seen steady at Tuesday auction.

text.p: The yield on Spanish six month Treasury bills at Tuesday's auction is expected to be little changed from the previous 5.551 percent rate, dealers said on Monday.
In any case, the yield will likely be set within the range of 5.55 and 5.60 percent, in line with grey market rates and with the auction exciting little investor interest.

"Tomorrow's auction won't provoke much interest and I think it's pretty clear that the Treasury hasn't room to cut the yield, as we saw at last week's one-year auction, despite the (25 basis point) cut in the Bank of Spain's key money rate," said one dealer.
"We could see the yield at 5.55 to 5.60 percent, without a great deal of demand," said a second dealer.
Yields on Treasury bills bottomed in February, coinciding with peseta exchange rate tension.

Although February inflation fell to a fresh low of 2.5 percent year-on-year, allowing a rate cut at the following Bank of Spain repo auction, peseta tension and reduced prospects for further rate cuts in the future mean that lower T-bill and interbank rates are more difficult, dealers said.
